text: Had a great time here for my birthday brunch. The bottomless mimosas are amazing just like our server Crystal. She was really sweet and kept making sure that we were okay. The food is also amazing I got the Fish tacos and guacamole. The only down fault was that there was a bit of a wait, so I would definitely recommend making reservations. I will definitely be coming back.
Make reservations. The food and drinks were excellent. The view was amazing and overall everything was great!!

Chris was our waiter, and he couldn't have been more attentive. He anticipated all of our needs and made sure our bottomless mimosas were never empty. He accommodated our ever expanding party without complaint and ensured that everyone was happy at all times.  If you have the chance ask for Chris!!

What saves this place from getting a 1 star is the great steak burger and side salad I ordered. Service was horrendously slow, the waiter pushed hard to upsell me Fiji water because they're tap water doesn't taste good! Load of crap that was. Prices are on the high end for simple food. The pork empanada appetizer was tasty but a very small portion! Compliments to the chef but that's about it here.

This is what you might expect from Vegas, tropicana as "fresh squeezed", corn syrup for maple, incredibly sweet breakfasts that if you're 14 you might like. A mocha cappuccino was clearly made by dumping some chocolate syrup in a cup and putting it under a vending machine. The old lady next to me loved it....doubt she uses yelp. Steer clear.

Pleasant setting and strong wifi. ;)
Good food but check out the portion size for a 18$ breakfast.... If you're super hungry, go somewhere else
Amazing!!  Best brunch spot in Vegas....and we are locals!!!  Ask for Napoleon....he's the best!!!
Loved having Britney B. as our server. She was very attentive and had such a sweet personality. Food and atmosphere was great - I would definitely recommend

We ate here a couple times while in Vegas. Every time we had amazing service with attentive staff. One morning we enjoyed the bottomless mimosa and our waitress even gave us mimosa in a cup to go! The food was also yummy, my omelette was super fluffy! Plus it's fun sitting by the pool:)

Over priced even for a Vegas lunch place. Horrible service if you don't look like you have money. Food had no flavor, even the chipotle chicken was bland. They didn't honor our reservation. Stunk this was our first place in Vegas.

Very cute little place with amazing breakfast food! They have a wide variety of choices. I got Nutella French toast sticks, which were amazing, and my boyfriend got the classic breakfast sandwich. Both were very good! The side potatoes are delicious as well! Prices are a little high for the amount of food that you get. Service was excellent even when they were busy.

Horrible. Incompetent staff, below average food- a watery chicken wrap, chicken fingers to be a make shift version of chicken and waffles that ended being croutons. No attention service... One person in our party left as she was not feeling well and an hour later her plate was removed from the table, after we asked for our check. Witnessed two other parties asking the hostess for the check as well. Three hour brunch that should have been 45 minutes.  AVOID THIS PLACE. not worth any attention!
Food was great but even more service AMAZING!! Particularly Jessica was attentive to our needs and very friendly!  The staff can make all the difference!
Food was good,  and prices were okay. The crabcake benedict is a smaller serving, but worth it. Very tasty.
Heather is amazing!!!! Best customer service ever. So attentive, great Vegas experience when trying to relax after a hard work week. Ask for Heather she's the best!

The red velvet waffles are wonderful, a little dry but not overly sweet. The menu mentioned cam cheese topping, but i did not get it. The service was great. Enjoyed breakfast outside on the patio and the hostess tried to bring an umbrella out for me, but when that want available she suggested a table in the shade.

I came to this grill 3 times this summer... I love this place! Bright friends and family to it and everyone loves it. Very convenient as I always stay at the Cosmopolitan and love the pool. Menu is not huge and I think I've tried every item and all REALLY good. Portions are huge... I usually take left overs to go. Wings are my favorite!! Staff is very attentive. Was sad to find out this is closed for the winter... Looking forward to coming back when it opens with the pool.
Service was good, food was good.  Best thing is the view and general atmosphere.  This is a nice option, especially for breakfast.

Overlook Grill touts itself as a Vegas version of a beachside cafe. Located next to The Cosmopolitan's amazing Boulevard Pool, they managed to do just that, with one key difference: Overlook Grill is less of a beachside cafe in Oxnard, and more like a beachside cafe in Santa Barbara -- trendy and pricey.

Showing up in the standard board shorts and tank tops might leave you feeling mildly underdressed in the small cafe area. For sun worshipers, there is outdoor seating available. Service was fast and very friendly, continuing The Cosmopolitan's trend of absolutely exceptional customer service. My server, Leslie, quickly introduced herself and got my drink order, and had it back in mere moments. She checked on me throughout, and even went so far as to offer me a soda refill to go as she presented the check. Now that's a nice extra touch.

The food selection is not huge. This is more of a place for simple and fresh than complex and overwhelming. Sandwiches, salads, a few fish items (I don't know why this was listed under "seafood" on Yelp), and a beer & wine list round out the menu. Cocktails can be ordered from the nearby pool bar if you're willing to wait a few moments.

I had a tough choice deciding between the Chicken Caesar Salad and the Ground Steak Burger, but went with the burger (there's a shock). The meat was juicy and tender, and the bun nice and soft. Toppings were fresh and crisp, and instead of dropping a bunch of squeeze bottles on the table, they served good portions of mayo, mustard, and ketchup in their own individual ramekins.

I LOVE RAMEKINS.

I even love saying the word "ramekins." Definitely a classy touch there.

I really wanted to try the fried clams, but as I was on a solo culinary adventure, I couldn't justify the piggyness. I would have liked it too if they had a dessert menu. Maybe a nice lemon meringue pie, or lime sherbet. Maybe a strawberry kiwi tart. I do love tarts. (Insert joke here.)

The only downfall is the price. After a burger, fries that had a hint of parmesean, and a soda, I was up around $17. Gack. That's not what I would expect to pay at a beachside cafe. That's when I realized, oh yeah, Santa Barbara, not Oxnard. So that is what it is.

Overall this place would have received a solid 3 star rating, but the service kicked it up a star. It probably won't fall into the "regular hangout" arena (unless you're part of the Nouveau Douche who parties all night on their parents' credit card, wake up at the crack of noon and roll out for the first meal of the day at 2pm), but for a nice bite for lunch now and then it's a great option.

PS: Gotta put out the full disclosure here: I work at the Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas, where Overlook Grill is located. However, as the hotel encourages honesty from its employees, I have been honest in this review. I am also not affiliated with the F&B department.

This was a lovely surprise.  I guess I didn't expect much from a hotel restaurant whose sole purpose seems to be feeding the pool-goers.  However, the Cosmopolitan did a great job here.  The location and interior are lovely, done in bright tropical colors.  The menu contains many small plates to choose from, reasonably priced (at least considering the location) and well executed.  
Though I didn't encounter any ground breaking cuisine, I did thoroughly enjoy my lunch and would be happy to return.  Special kudos to the mixologist for some delicious, well-balanced cocktails.
We started our meal with the Garlic Edamame, which was my favorite snack of the day.  We also split: BBQ Ribs, the Mezze Plate, Strawberry Mascarpone French Toast, and another item I can't remember.
Our server was very pleasant and attentive, though he did not know the menu well and could not answer our questions.  For dessert, we ordered a few of the minis, which were very attractively presented, but just OK.  The whoopie pies especially were served with cold buttercream filling, which in my book is a huge no-no.
The food is always terrific here and our server hallie was fantastic! So personable ! Looking forward to come back again :3

Swing-and-a-miss!!!!  Absolutely loved the Cosmopolitan Hotel vibe and stopped by a few of their dining options.  Decided on this spot for our final lunch before catching a flight home.  Had to sit inside due to wind.  That said, the restaurant had a nice open and airy feel.  Now on to the bad.....

My lovely wife ordered the Fish Tacos (highly recommended).  After waiting a considerable amount of time they finally arrived and we found them to be just okay.  We had a tremendous length of time to offer our opinions as they brought me a hamburger instead of my Chicken sandwich (oops).  They took that away and promised to hustle my meal out to us.

Finally, we evaluated my sandwich and found it to be just decent.  Server was very sorry for the mix up.  Not so sorry that they offered a free drink, entree, still water...anything.  In fact, it was never mentioned after the initial screw-up.

Just odd.  Service was disjointed and basically disinterested.  Food was just okay.  Nice location, though.  Try it out.  I won't again.  But you can:)

Stopped in for breakfast today - had nice seats in the shade with a little mister action. I had California eggs Benedict and husband had traditional - both very good! Hallie our server was efficient and friendly! With massage appointments later, we skipped the bottomless mimosas, but the table next to us said they were good!

I was pleasantly surprised that they were far better than 3-1/2 stars. 

Greeted by a friendly staff, quick service (our wonderful server Sunny showed up as soon as we sat down), warm & tasty food, nice decor, etc.

It's a bit on pricy side (breakfast is $15-$18), but hey, a restaurant in Cosmo, by the poolside, beats eating some cheap bacon & eggs at dirty old casino any day!!
I found this spot to be rather mediocre for breakfast.  My eggs were undercooked (ordered them over well), bacon was limp, and service was extremely slow and spotty.
Good location and view of the pool. Service was great and the detox salad with salmon was amazing!

Since my boyfriend and I were staying at the Cosmo, we decided to go here for breakfast for the convenience. It was here or Mon Ami Gabi at Paris. We chose here. 

The restaurant is sunny, clean, poolside, and overall very appealing. I loved how the entire place was large window panels; it made it super bright. Just don't sit directly in the sun because it gets very hot. The minus two stars is for the attitude of the employees and the price. 1 breakfast sandwich + 1 eggs/bacon + 1 coffee + 2 juices = $60.00. Even steep for Vegas. The food is average for a breakfast place. 

The hostess was a little short when we entered the place. Our waitress, who I believe was French, also had a slight attitude. I didn't mind that much, but if you are expected a warm and friendly welcome don't expect it. 

The restaurant was full, there was maybe one empty table at a time. Every single person in the restaurant minus one waiter was white. The place felt very country club. To some that is a plus, to some that is a minus. 

The food was decent. The bacon was a little thick and undercooked for my taste, so specify how you like your bacon. The house potatoes were good - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The eggs were cooked to how I ordered them. The coffee was hot and tasty + free refills which they were very on top of. 


Overall, the place was nice. It was an enjoyable breakfast experience. But for Yelp, 3 stars for sure.

The wind was blowing pretty viciously that our silverware was blown off the table.  We didn't worry too much because they quickly found a solution to the problem and accommodated us. 

There isn't too much to say about their entrees, but, their guacamole is pretty amazing and their Spicy Big Eye Tuna appetizer can be easily called one of the best, fairly priced, appetizers in Las Vegas. 

Oh, and they have bottomless mimosas on Sunday's which we all love. 

#TheHungersons

Really cool spot at the Cosmo that has an open view to the rooftop pool. A little hard to find, you have to take an elevator to the very top which is a little hidden but theres people giving directions. Went here for the mimosa pitchers which are amazing if you love brunch! Food wise their country potatoes are delicious and their waffles are amazing too! We didn't have reservation but got seated right away since it seemed to be a slow day. Our server was great and even offered to get us mimosas to go but we couldn't take any more after drinking two pitchers. Definitely a great place for brunch in Vegas!

A little windy that day but great service, good food, and nice atmosphere. My friend and I did lunch here for pretty cheap, they were more than willing to split a meal on to two plates for us with no fuss or extra charge. We also indulged in the $18 bottomless mimosas, that our waitress was nice enough to give us in to go cups when we left.

The 1st time I dined here - it was fabulous.

HOWEVER

I had lunch yesterday at the Overlook Grill with two clients and it was a let down.

I ordered the fresh halibut with heirloom tomato salad. 18.00
It was tasty, but the fish was the smallest piece of fish I have ever been served. My first thought was, " It's a lunch sized portion ... " (It was probably was 4 .5 " x 4)

But here is the clincher! 
There was a couple sitting right next to my table and the waitress served them each a lunch entree.  The guy had the SAME halibut special ... but the fish was twice as thick as mine and it was a normal size. It hardly looked like the same entree!

I couldn't help but ask the waitress why there was such a difference.
(I hated sounding so petty.)
She said - that the couple were sharing the halibut. 

They each had their own entree, so I felt like she was making excuses.

I nicely commented that I thought the chef should be more consistent with serving sizes and she didn't say much.

I didn't want to make a big deal in front of my clients - but I will not be returning to this restaurant.  There are too many other fabulous places to eat in town.

I don't mind paying a high price for a great meal - but do expect a reasonable portion size and for my comment to be recognized and not just shrugged off.

This place rocks. It's like going to the fountain of Youth and eating the potatoes. Off. The. Hook. $40 tasting menu brunch was amazing, crab cake benedict was out of this world, our server Wyatt was way chill, helped out with all our needs, and the long islands were house made with ginger. Full on success, color us some happy campers.

Just tried this place out and it has to be my second favorite brunch spot on the strip! The restaurant itself has a beachy/California vibe with indoor and outdoor patio seating overlooking the Cosmopolitan Pool.

Our server, Alejandro, was a sweetheart. He was very friendly, interacted with our table, made jokes with us, and was attentive. We also had Hallie, who was knowledgeable and gave great recommendations and kept going above and beyond for us. 

A few dishes worth raving about. First, the tableside guacamole was delicious. Our avocado boy, Antonio, was sweet and engaging, even posing for a photo with our group. Second, the empanadas, oooh yes. Simple ingredients just cheese, peppers, and corn but so tasty. 

For a main entrée, the dish you must absolutely get is the Fat Elvis!! This is a peanut butter, banana, frosted flakes, and bacon French toast that is to die for! I would also like to suggest the avocado toast with hollandaise and a poached egg. The flavors all go together in such a wonderful way. The dishes are quite large, so great portion sizes for a brunch and even some food left over for later!

The pricing is decent, I would say around $25-$30 per person. I will def be returning here for another meal in the future!

I really liked this place. Came here for Sunday brunch and we had their tapas style brunch. Loved the crab Benedict's and the scallop dish. They will bring more of whatever you like but with 13 dishes we were stuffed.

Went here on a typical guys weekend. Great breakfast! Sitting outside is great too! No complaints here!!

Eggs Benedict is the way to go here! Great coffee as well.

The Overlook Grill is an awesome choice for day drinking and eating!!!

We were here this past weekend with a party of about 6.  We didn't have reservations, but were able to get one of the outside tables with the comfy chairs and cushions.  Our seat overlooked the jacuzzi and you could see part of the pool.  The umbrellas offered awesome shade coverage for my transparent skin while my other party members were able to scoot their chairs into the sun for some worshipping.  

The food was really good and the drinks strong!!!  We all opted for appetizers...trying to remember all of them...sliders, crab salad, hummus, and so on.  All were excellent.  

We had the BEST waitress, but I have forgotten her name.  She was a very cute Asian girl with cute, red Versace glasses (trying to be descriptive so she gets the credit she deserves!!!).  She was nice, quick, efficient, and a polite smart ass...just great with our group.

We will definitely be back to The Overlook Grill on our next Vegas visit!!!
Went for Restaurant Week but honestly the food was kinda boring.

Had the breakfast burrito and French  toast all very good and the best part of it was the waitress Jessica who was extremely on top of service one of the best waitresses  i have ever had and I eat out ALOL a lot

Cute little cafe hidden by the overlook pool! Very small menu and decent food but timing was very slow. 50's style decor and tons of windows for people watching. With all the places to go in Vegas I might keep searching!

Great service and food at the poolside grill! I think the best thing is the BOTTOMLESS Champagne !!!   Have a great lunch and drink as much bubbly as you can in 2 hours.  Once you are ready to leave they even let you take a to go cup!  This is such a great option especially since drinks are all $10 + at the pool bar.  Everyday we stayed at the cosmo we would hit the overlook grill for lunch.  Awesome spot.

Since we were staying at the hotel we thought to have a quick breakfast here. 

It is located on the fourth floor right next to the pool area. 

When we entered the hostess greeted us and let us know to wait a couple of minutes while an outside table was being cleared. A minute later she lead us to the table that overlooked the pool and handed us the menus. 

Very small breakfast/lunch menu. I ordered the ciabatta breakfast sandwich (sub. the fried eggs for egg whites) and asked for fruit instead of fried potatoes. And lots of coffee. 

Cheechee was our sever and he was fabulous! Very accommodating and always checked on my coffee mug and water. They never went empty. He made small talk about 4th of July and asked about our stay. 

After about 20 minutes the food arrived. The sandwich was an average portion, made the way I had requested but the bacon was mainly all fat. I had to take half the bacon out which left the sandwich a little wimpy. 

Prices are high for what the food is worth and portion. The sandwich was $14.00,  hub's red velvet waffle was $14.00 and regular brewed coffee was $4.00. After tax  and tip was close to $40.00. 

With the better breakfast/lunch spots around I wouldn't come back.
Great spot. Not too crowded. Has an amazing view. Food is delicious and not overpriced. Service is friendly and unlimited mimosas are amazing.

I came here for breakfast and liked it a lot. The bottomless mimosas obviously won me over, and the breakfast sandwich was quite good. Our server was excellent, really friendly and most importantly, really patient with us as we waited for friends to arrive and took a long time to order. Wish I'd discovered this place before my last morning in Vegas, but still glad I did. Really enjoyable.

We came here around 2 pm for a late lunch. The fish tacos were excellent. We split them between 2 people, the portion was big enough to do so, and the kitchen split it onto two plates for us. Service was slow, so this may not be the place if you are on a time crunch.
Food was good but the service sucked. They stopped checking on us and we had to go to the front of the house to pay our bill. Not really happy at all with the service.

We had a pretty rough weekend at the Cosmo and werent really enjoying the place. We came here annoyed, hungover, burnt out. The table took MUCH longer than promised but once we sat down, all was great. The server we had was amazing! He was such a sweet guy. All of the servers were great actually. I got the prix fix $40- DO IT! Its everything on the menu and so MUCH FOOD! If you like a particular item, they will keep bringing you more. Me and my girlfriends all pretty much ended up sharing all of my food.
The monkey bread is off the hook!
This place has great food. I had the French toast and the bottomless mimosas. It was amazing! Definitely coming back here. Charles gave us great service with the best food suggestions.

I thought the food here was pretty terrible. The fish tacos that everyone raves about was filled with old gray fish. Even the guacamole and chips weren't very good. It's get a star for the poolside service. Maybe if you drink more the people in the pool look hotter and this borderline yucky food tastes better.

It's really a 2.5 but I'll round up since it's so new.

I ate here twice over the weekend, once for a company lunch and again for lunch with friends the next day.

Company lunch menu:
Ceviche - refreshing and loved the plain chips
Hummus - meh, I've had better and the pita was tough/hard
Salad - simple w/ shaved parmesan and balsamic
Crispy Cauliflower - delicious!  Really enjoyed the cauliflower and the dipping sauce
Sliders - really simple beef sliders w/o cheese, tasty despite just being beef, lettuce, and tomato
Chicken w/ brie and pear mini-sandwich - the French bread it was on was too tough so I removed the bread and fork/knifed this one. It was just ok and could use more brie.
Shoestring fries - tasty! I wanted to eat more but didn't want to look like the pig that I am in front of my co-workers
Veggie panini - i got a biteful of grilled zucchini only, no real flavors
Fruit for dessert - it was fresh, can't really mess it up otherwise
Mini chocolate cake - tasty and just the right sized bite

Lunch:
I got the kahlua pork tostadas, which was a good portion and had tasty kahlua pork.  Maybe a little salty, but that was balanced out with the tortilla and the cabbage slaw w/ tomatoes and queso fresco.

The food was overall ok, though some misses (hummus, chicken/veggie sandwiches), but service is what brings this place down.  Seriously clueless hostess and servers who ignore you but try to be uber-friendly when they finally come around.  I never really saw my server but the guys in suits were always willing to help out.  It just seemed like the service was not coordinated at all.

I'd recommend for lunch but make sure to allot more time than anticipated for this place.

I saw a (drunk) couple complaining about having to wait way too long to get their take-out order.  They probably got drunk because they had enough time to drink enough while waiting for their food to be ready.  On top of that, they had problems charging the guy's credit card and somehow charged something twice or charged the wrong thing, whatever it was.  Like I said, some of the people who work there are clueless.  I hope they get with the program soon.

Outstanding Bloody Mary! At $17, it better be, right? A very large drink, garnished with celery, a skewer of cherry tomatoes, goat cheese stuffed green olives, and a strip of bacon! It's the perfect way to kick off poolside Vegas breakfast.

So filling, I couldn't finish even half of my order of mascarpone topped cinnamon french toast! My husband ordered the steak and egg stuffed breakfast burrito. It was delicious as well. The coffee was also excellent here.

Great service. Great food. I had such an amazing time here with an awesome server, Gus!  The food was exactly what I needed after a night of shenanigans.  Did I mention the bottomless mimosas?!  Delish. Tried the  crab lettuce wraps & the spicy tuna. So much flavor & tasted so fresh. Also had the eggs your way. Portions are generous, leaving everyone at the table full & satisfied! I will def be back for some more overlook grill!!
Heather was amazing! Her service was on point and was so friendly! Will return for sure! Thank you thank you heather!!!!

We love restaurants with outdoor seating, so we looked up this place and gave it a try.

It's located on the 4th level by the pool(s).  Outdoor seating is a joke.  They only have 3 or 4 tables for dining;  the other outdoor seating was basically set up for drinks/socializing.  After being seated at a table (barely outside) we decided to move to one of the other seats (outside);  it was small, but at least it had a view of the pool and some sun.

We waited about 10 minutes, still no waitress.  At that point, we got up and left.  Ended up across the street at another outdoor spot.

Not sure where Jason is used to eating, but I wouldn't call the outside area "amazing."  View of the pool is weak.  Try Terrace Point (Wynn), or Gardunos (Palms) if you want a better pool view.

Turkey burger.... 

Didn't finish it it was so bad... Garlic soy glaze edamame were sweet was expecting a salty garlic edamame. Wait they sprinkled it with salt attempting a savory finish.  We should have just eaten by the pool. It's the same food and just as bad of service. At least by the pool you know what type of service you are going to get.

This place is fantastic. Our server Jessica was fantastic and attentive but not overbearing. The food was amazing and the service was friendly and efficient. The build your own mimosa was delicious and included high quality ingredients.

HELLOOOOOOOOO cosmo!  My friends and I stumbled upon the Overlook during the opening weekend of the ever so amazing Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino.  Some of our group were already there dining, and selected this restaurant based on its decent prices. though the cosmo was filling up w/ tourists ready to check out the hottest hotel on the strip, we were seated promptly in the small restaurant. 

FOOD:
1. TUNA MEZZALUNA- bright and satisfying.
2. FISH DIP - thick, flavorful....a cream cheese type of based dip with bits of seafood.  i found it a bit rich, and the crackers served alongside it were very sturdy for dipping.  
3. FRENCH FRIES- YUM! i'm a fan of skinny fries with the perfect amount of crisp on the outside, and starchy goodness on the inside
4. FISH OF THE DAY (SCALLOPS) - our friends ordered the fish of the day, which i got to sample.  its very hard to find a decently priced restaurant that doesn't serve overcooked or rubbery scallops.  luckily, overlook was on point that day.  perfectly cooked and tender just the way you get them at an overly priced 5 star restaurant.


DRINK:
1. BRAZILIAN WAX- tart, peppery, and a nice twist on the usual breakfast margarita! hahaha
2. (some pretty pink cocktail. see photos)- sweet...all i can say. my boyfriend only ordered it because it matched his shirt. LOL.

SERVICE:
i don't know if it was because we were asian, and had an asian server, but our server (i forgot her name) was very attentive and friendly.  she did disappear for a while when getting us our check, but came back apologetic and explained that they were still training in the midst of service, which i can understand. not like we were in any rush to leave las vegas anyway!

AMBIANCE:
bright, modern, yet earthy design, good beats in the background, artwork that captures old town beach vibes,  

the menu was small, but keep in mind it was still literally its 3rd day open as our server explained they were still in the process of printing out menus....there was no drink menu present (at least when we visited) so ask your server for what drinks they serve. also, we came on a saturday (12/18/10) and they were closing well before 5pm.  again, that could have been due to the fact that this is a newbie restaurant.

Love it!   This restaurant is located on the 4th floor and overlooks the pool area.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.   Everyone was sitting inside due to the cold weather this time of year.  It has a cool retro, cabana decor . The menu is not large but has a nice variety of healthy choices.

I tried the pomegranate margarita drink special...so good!.    We both had the Tuna Mezzaluna....slices of ahi tuna cooked to perfection over fresh thin, cut string beans, small cubed feta cheese, slivers of red onions, garbanzo beans, soft croutons and sliced olives.   Great combination of tastes.   

As I was finishing my tuna mezzaluna, I overhead a waitress mention the banana cream pie. I couldn't remember the last time I had banana cream pie and I had to try it.   I asked what they had for dessert.  There were three selections; banana cream pie, key lime pie, and some peach dessert.     We shared the banana cream pie.... yum!

If you are looking for a healthy meal with a casual yet hip atmosphere and excellent, friendly service, try the Overlook Grill.

Skip it
I had breakfast at the Overlook Cafe this morning. Resting alongside the Cosmopolitan pool the location was pleasant, the decor simple with a bright and airy vibe.  My party was seated right away (the restaurant was not busy )where we waited for several minutes until our server took our drink order.  The menu is limited so diners should take a look online before making the effort.  We placed our orders  and everything was adequate- that was until we needed something. While waiting for our food no one came by to check our drained coffee cups once. This was puzzling as four overly eye-lashed hostesses stood gossiping at the host stand, meanwhile we couldn't get a refill for the far overpriced coffee.  Our food arrived, and we finally had an opportunity to request  a change in the over 15 minute beverage deficit.  Absolutely unacceptable.
Overall:
Food was average. There are no frills, extras, or anything noteworthy. Not worth the money and you can find a better breakfast for less.
Service is terrible.  Too many "helpers" and not enough doers. Do not come thirsty. Recommend restaurant leave a carafe for diners drinking coffee in multiples.
Location is nice if you're already there but I wouldn't go out of my way.

Great spot for breakfast if you're staying at the Cosmopolitan. It has both indoor and outdoor seating. Staff is very well trained. Only disappointment was the oatmeal. I expected a sweet dish with cherries like I use in my Manhattans. Instead it was a mult-grain/legume concoction with dried fruit. I thought it tasted a little salty too. The seating is comfortable, but odd. The seats have some type of spring mechanism. Feels a little like a lumpy bed.

This restaurant was wonderful! Only a 20 minute wait for a table, and with the restaurant overlooking the pool and cabana area there was plenty to watch while we waited. We each ordered a mimosa, and upon ordering a second the waitress recommended bottomless and did not charge for our first round. We tried the overlook omelette and the Benedict. Portion sizes are perfect, with a stellar atmosphere.

Pretty average weekday brunch. Wasn't crowded or loud. The Bloody Mary was excellent. Their gf bread was pretty good. My husband had monkey bread, and chicken/waffles. He was disappointed- it was a breaded chicken breast fillet. The food wasn't ground breaking, but it was a fine experience overall.

Boulevard pool restaurant at Cosmopolitan hotel. nice seatings, relaxing and comfy. we went there for lunch.

It was their restaurant week, they have a tasting menu for $30 per person, I had fat tire on tab, hummus with pita bread, grilled chicken sandwich, and chocolate mousse, bf had catch of the day. 

love the hummus! it was so tasty! I couldn't get enough of those, my grilled chicken sandwich wasn't that great, the fries were yummy, but the chicken was a little burned, bf's catch of the day was perfect, we red relish made like flowers in the plate, so pretty and delicious. the chocolate mousse was the best! 

service was good, food was great, perfect place for pool times or just a casual lunch. I liked it. :)

Total bill for 2 people with one tab beer: $70

The Overlook Grill is located on level 4 of the Cosmopolitan Hotel on the Las Vegas strip. It's location is fine - next to the pool areas but not so close that you would be bothered by anything happening there.

I ordered a cheesesteak panini which was surprisingly decent. Not the best cheesesteak sandwich I ever had, but certainly above average for this sort of thing.

Price was $18. Not worth that amount of money, but we *are* on the strip, and everything is expensive here so I don't know how much weight I should give to the pricing structure. 

The only thing I would complain about is that it seemed like they took awhile (30 minutes) to get my food out, which was just the sandwich with fries, but then again, everything is supposed to be fresh and cooked to order so maybe this isn't a big deal.

Bottom line: if you are looking for a laid-back lunch and you are in the Cosmopolitan/Bellagio area, give them a shot.

I was in Las Vegas with my best friend to see a show, and the morning after we were on the hunt for a delicious brunch. We walked over to the cosmopolitan where we looked around and discovered the Overlook Grill! We were seated immediately, despite the fact it was noon on a Saturday. The restaurant has a really nice indoor/outdoor aesthetic that is very fresh and clean, situated above the strip on the pool deck level of the hotel. The menu was simple, but had quite a few great options! I ordered the 3 egg breakfast, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. My friend had the breakfast sandwich which was also excellent. The place is a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but really conveniently located and totally worth a visit! I have been underwhelmed by a lot of spots on the strip, and I was very pleasantly surprised to find this great restaurant.
Antonio made guacamole in front of us according to our taste. Adam's service was on point. We enjoyed a delicious brunch here today!! Will definitely come back for more. Thanks for an awesome time.

Hallie was amazing, I would recommend her as your server. I've worked as a bartender for 12 years. She's good, and you can tell enjoys serving people. Unless you're a jerk who has no idea what it's like to work in a restaurant than what do you know? Nothing, shut up and stop complaining jerk face... thanks for playing go to McDonald's love joryen

My girlfriends and I randomly stumbled upon this place while visited the Cosmopolitan. It was very nice, chill atmosphere. The restaurant was right next to the pool and the windows were open to let the fresh air in. 

They are constantly changing their menu so I'm not sure if the stuff I write about will be still relevant tomorrow, but here goes. Their menu is split into small plates and large plates. I would say the small plates are enough for the ladies, while the large plates are more for men and sharing. I think the fact that they change their menu is a negative since I really like the dishes they have. Their service also could have been faster. Took us forever to order and get the check. 

For an appetizer, we ordered the deep cauliflower which was so yummy. I loved that crispy and crunchy texture. I ordered the pork belly lettuce wraps (small plate). There were two of them on my plate and they were so refreshing on such a sunny day. The cold noodles with that crispy, thick piece of pork belly was heavenly. I'm drooling thinking about it now. My girlfriend ordered the fish tacos. This was the first time I tried a taco with both soft and hard shells. I became a fan after one bite. It was so tasty. I really enjoyed the tangy sauce that was drizzled on top of it.

Such a nice surprise and wonderful last meal for a great Vegas trip!
Hallie and Ty both waited on my boyfriend and I and we had THE MOST AMAZING SERVICE!! The food was so good and the ambiance is perfect.

Came here because it was close by our hotel.   They don't have a huge menu-I ended up getting the fish tacos, even though I wanted lunch.  Should've looked online for the menu first.  It was also pretty expensive for brunch.  Service wasn't that good-the waitress was inattentive and it took a long time to order, get our food, get our check.  There were two other big groups, so the waitress was more attentive to them.  There's better brunch places to go to in Vegas.

Came in for brunch sat immediately which was nice and the waiter was even prompt at taking our drink order. After waiting for almost 20 min for our drinks and the waiter to even come and acknowledge us we got up to leave. The place was not busy it just seemed like none of the workers knew what they were doing they all seemed a little confused except for the hostess

Came here after looking at line on Wicked Spoon and was pleasantly surprised.  Lunch was about $16/$17. I had a tuna dish over beans and enjoyed every bite. 

Wouldn't call this place economical but some of the dishes are worth your buck.  On top of a fantastic meal, we were served by friendly and cute waiter Steve (my friends couldn't stop gushing; I hope the thirst wasn't too evident. Haha)

Whenever I visit Vegas, I try to go here at least once for brunch no matter where I am staying on the strip. The Overlook Grill has an amazing outdoor patio and indoor lounging area that is right by the pool so it gives you that relaxing feeling. 

The service is always fantastic when I go! This past time, our server Adam was awesome! He was really good with his prompt service when we sat down, even though we were not ready to order (our fault for not looking at the menu right away,) he continued to check in to see if we were. We also ordered the house made guacamole, and although I forgot his name who made it for us, he was also a really great person to have by our table for the duration of him making it for us. He also kept great conversation the whole time, explained how the process is when making guacamole, how he is now the go to person for his friends at gatherings, and where he was from (Ventura.) Hope some of that helps with whom he is! 

The bottomless mimosas are probably the best you can get on the strip that I know of, and I brunch a lot in Vegas. You can choose the $18 deal where you only get orange juice or the $20 deal where you can pick your three flavors throughout your visit. I usually go with the $18 deal only because I like orange juice with my mimosas. 

Food is just as amazing and delicious as well! I got the breakfast burrito while my partner got the French Toast. The burrito came in the perfect temperature and was so yummy to eat! I couldn't stop. I tried a bit of the French Toast as well and it was so sweet and perfect! If you do not like super sweet food, this would not be for you. The guacamole that was made for us could have been a bit more hefty on the portion for a table of 4, but the texture, amount of seasoning and spices were perfect! Probably the best starter dish on the menu! Unfortunately was not able to get a photo due to the fact that we started and finished too quickly. 

I would recommend this place to anyone that is considering a place for brunch.

Hallie is the best server I have ever had. She took such good care of us, bringing us water, mimosas, food, and anything we could ever have dreamed of. We had such a fun time, food and drinks were A+, if you're staying at the cosmo, come hang with Hallie
Great ambiance and food. Friendly staff. Not much outdoor seating, but when it is 105 outside, I'd rather be inside anyway.

The lobster sandwich is incredible. From the toasted bread to the side salad, I devoured the entire thing in minutes. It's a little more expensive than I would have liked, but I have to say, it really is worth it. Bottomless mimosas for $18.
Avocado eggs Benedict were the best I've had. Also, bottomless mimosas are a great deal and they gave us to go cups. Wonderful experience.

On our last day, we were wandering around The Cosmopolitan a little on the earlier side (11am or so, early for me) trying to find a place to sit and relax before hitting the road. The temptation of pizza was certainly lingering, but I figured I should attempt to find something different from the two slices I had the night prior. 

A host from a different restaurant recommended Overlook Grill on the 4th floor out by the pool since they were already up and running serving brunch so we took the elevator up where a friendly hostess let us check out a menu. Finding things we both would eat, this was our choice. 

I was trying to decide between chicken fingers and the OG burger and I went with the burger, since I figured it would keep me full for the drive. Also ordered the detox bowl with salmon minus avocado, and just had water as our beverage. Sitting inside as we waited, we had a partial view of the pool outside, along with the outside tables, some directly in sunlight.

Food was brought out in a timely matter, and everything was perfect. The only odd thing was that the detox bowl allegedly contained kale, but there definitely wasn't kale in the mix. I'd consider getting the detox bowl w/ chicken on my next visit. 

Overlook Grill was the most ideal spot for us to relax and enjoy the earlier part of the day before the long car ride home. Reasonable prices, decent food and service.

Amazing! Andy and I have been here a few times for brunch and both times were exceptional. We sat outside and the views are beautiful. Not sure if this is an only weekend thing but both times we had the $18 per person bottomless mimosas, which is always a win! Food wise you truly can't get better then the crab lettuce wraps. The crab is so fresh and it's topped with a small dab of a chipotle aioli and a slice of red pepper.
We also had the chicken tacos. They were cooked to perfection with the right amount of crunch! And to finish the meal we got the poke bowl. Probably the best poke bowl I've ever had. So fresh and light yet filling. This is by far one of our favorite brunch spots and we will defiantly be back!

For the price, I didn't think Overlook Grill was worth it. The food was good but for the price we could of went to a nice buffet instead. We ordered the fish tacos, a chicken wrap (the fries were REALLY good!) and a Dragons Breath (blackberry mojito). 
The service was good and the staff was very friendly. The restaurant is located by the pool and it has a cool little vibe with flat screen tv's in it but $55 for a small lunch w/tip? I think we'll pass on Overlook Grill next time.

OOO
3 out of 5 Afros

Napoleon was 10/10 the best server I've had experienced in a while. He was very accommodating and made our experience at overlook grill amazing. He deserves a promotion. And also the food was amazing and mimosas were 10/10.

My friend & I went here for brunch today. I got the California BLT Benedict which was delicious along with the bottomless mimosa's (good price of $18 for 2 hour limit). Waiter was awesome as well, very helpful when trying to decide what to get. Nice place for Sunday brunch, good atmosphere, centrally located, poolside. 
My only complaint was that we called at 12 to make a reservation incase they were busy & I was told we wouldn't be able to be seated until 1pm & they couldn't guarantee us a table with a pool view. We got there at 12:23pm & were seated immediately with plenty of tables open. With that being said, host customer service wasn't the greatest, over the phone or in person.
I love this place for brunch! The service was fantastic and the food was good! The view is pretty good too!!

Wow.  The Overlook Grill really does have it all: Great food, service, view, and atmosphere.  

Definitely order the empanadas - they are absolutely delicious.  Ryan M. loved the Tuna Mezzaluna.  I enjoyed my two mimosas.  Caeser salad was good on its own (skip the charbroiled shrimp).  Stay and chat awhile with the wonderfully conversational staff.

Came for brunch after reading a glowing review.  We arrived at 11 am, and were told that brunch ends at 11.  By definition, brunch should run until the end of lunch!  So don't come for BRUNCH because they don't serve that here, and remember they only serve BREAKFAST until 11.
Loved the healthy choice options. Tuna poke bowl was awesome. Cajun shrimp salad didn't disappoint. Did not have drinks but people looked happy with bottomless mimosas

Second best tuna sandwich on the strip. (1st is Earl's of Sandwich at PH).
Best fruit salad with yogurt that I've tasted in a long time!

Warning tho: Shoes and shirts or No service.
I learned this the hard way after a day at the Boulevard Pool. Because they are right-next-to the pool, I assume I coulda rolled in there in my barefoot bikini wear but, NO.
It was so good we had to go to brunch / breakfast here twice!! Great prices, BEYOND great staff and amazing food!  $18 bottomless mimosas and rose! Gustavo was the best waiter all weekend.

I love Overlook Grill. I mean LOVE- the big L word. I wait for it to be open seasonally to take people to brunch here. Bottomless mimosas or the delicious and spicy Bloody Mary starts off brunch as it should be. The Benedict is cooked well and the hollandaise makes you want to lick the plate. You get to watch patrons of the pool saunter by and enjoy the Vegas skyline. The homemade guacamole's a great shareable and the menu ya plenty to choose from whether you want to indulge or if you're on a health kick. The staff is always super friendly and accommodating. At the moment- I'm waiting for the season to open again!

Ok. I understand this is on the strip. But that doesn't mean you have to sacrifice quality of food. $17 for a omelette that has the same eggs you get at the Holiday Inn. The potatoes were straight from a bag. The service was good just unfortunate the food does not match the service. You can still use fresh ingredients and make money. The wife did enjoy her eggs Benedict.
My husband loved the "Scotch Egg."  I had breakfast here three days in a row.  The red velvet waffle is amazing and the breakfast sandwich is tasty as well.  What a lovely place to have a meal.

I had a Mediterranean Chopped Salad with bottomless mimosas. The food came out quickly and tasted great. The waitress was really friendly and kept the mimosas coming! We sat near the window with the view of the beautiful pool. It was an overall good brunch experience.

We went to this place on a whim because we just wanted somewhere nearby our Airbnb at Veers towers (behind Aria) before our flight that day.

I was super excited to see they had a banana mixed drink! And the server was correct in that the coconut liqueur in it wasn't that strong. Yay, because I hate coconut. It was really good, I loved the dried banana slices on top for better presentation.

However, I can't say the food was as good. I got their house omelette which is supposed ot have bacon, tomatoes, avocados, and onions I think. However the avocado/guac or whatever inside the omelette way overpowered everything. I could barely access any of the other fillings, I literally scraped out a lot of it so I could have a balance for my tastebuds. Oh yeah, and I'm also not crazy about filled omelettes rather than the ingredients being cooked into the egg. 
the potatoes and toast were pretty good! I guess.

My boyfriend ordered a benedict. He didn't have much to say about it.

On another positive note: the server was super young, nice, and friendly! Also, they have a beautiful view of the Cosmo pool.
My mouth is salivating and this French toast is to die for.. first time it was worth screwing the calories

Best fish tacos on this planet.  Taco bell style double taco with sauce between!  (You can order these from the limited menu at boulevard pool too).  

The atmosphere is preppy, classy and fun.  A little fresher than the trendy vibe inside the Cosmo.  Our server was the sweetest girl I've ever met.  It's like they take attractive summer camp counselors and have them bring you brunch.  Just the best.

We had brunch for 20 people. The food was good and they kept the bottomless mimosas coming. There's a pool outside with great views of the strip. We sat inside so it was a little uncomfortable because we had such a large party and we were being loud... (to be expected with 20 people on a Vegas vacation + bottomless mimosas). My only negative is that they cold only split the check 4 ways so it took 30 minutes for my less than sober friends to figure out how to split the bill and collect funds. Overall a solid brunch

Ordered the pork tostadas and fries to go so that my friend and I could have a little picnic by the pool. 

The pork tostadas was salty, dry, and not good at all. The fries were cooked well but really salty. There was a fruit salad of mangoes and tomatoes and it wasn't good. 

I had also requested water but they forgot to give that to me. But I went to the bar and got water there.

Two words: Bottomless Mimosas. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good brunch that won't break the bank. The food overall was decent. Would be 3 stars if just judging on that. Between our party we had poached eggs, the breakfast sandwich, the special Korean bbq buns, and fish tacos (the last two were the better choices). But what makes this place great and the reason for 4 stars are the bottomless mimosas that are only $18 each which is cheap for Vegas. Pair this with the open breeze and its perfect for a summertime brunch by the pool! Additionally, the service we had was spectacular- our sever was so nice and she kept our mimosas full. Huge plus as you know most places that advertise bottomless aren't as quick to refill. Overall great drinks and great view for a fun afternoon on the Strip!

We stopped on New Year's day for brunch and we were not disappointed.   They had an excellent make your own bloody mary bar which was fantastic.   I don't think I've ever encountered one with so many options.  The food was great.  A friend and I had the scotch egg and our other guests had an omelet and steak & eggs.   Our table was beyond pleased.   Great way to start the new year.

BEST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD. We had a group of 6 girls and Hallie was the best server we've ever had! The food was great but the service was AMAZING. Hallie kept the mimosas coming and she made our experience so much more fun. I will definitely come back! Love this place. Ask for her! #hallie

The Overlook Grill has a very Summer-y feel to it. The theme of the restaurant has the colors yellow and white and the Hosts and Waitresses wear really cute matching Summer dresses that makes the whole setting 10x even better 'cause I feel like I'm in the Caribbeans :)

The restaurant is located outside in the Pool area (near to Marquee Nightclub). I really liked the restaurant and the service was spectacular; however, the choices of food items are very limited. 

The menu only has about ~15 items and every single item is VERY different from the other. I was really hungry (and hungover..but who isn't in Vegas?) and seeing the menu made me feel very disappointed. 

What we ended up ordering was:

($12) Kalua Pork Tosta and ($20) 1 Dozen Raw Oysters to share. As for drinks, we had a ($6) Corona and a ($12) Bloody Mary. 

I would pass on the Kalua Pork Tostas...there are only (2) and the portions are really small. I really wish they told us that what we ordered wasn't enough to share because the wait for the food took a long time as well. When the oysters were brought out, my immediate reaction was "WTF? They're SO TINY!!!!!!!!" but never judge a book by it's cover!!! They were the best damn oysters I've ever had in my life! and trust me, I've tried a variety of oysters from a variety of locations. They actually weren't that small because the oysters were actually pretty meaty and fresh- YUM!

I probably would only come back for the oysters and that's probably it. The rest of the meal was pretty pricey. On a side note, I felt kind of bad for tipping our waitress too because the only time she ever came to our table was to hand us our check. The Manager and the Hostess were the ones who helped us out the entire time, I wish I tipped them instead!!

Today was my first experience with the Overlook Grill.  I really enjoy the ambiance and the hip vibe that the venue provides so I am providing 4 stars based upon that.  There were lots of choices on the menu that I had in mind for lunch.  The service can definitely be improved.  I was waiting for my colleague so I decided to sit down at our table for her.  It seemed as though the servers were confused as to who had what section.  It took a long time for someone to greet me at the table to take my drink order.  A server finally came over and took my drink order.  A few minutes later, another Server did the same thing.  I ended up making an order for an appetizer of fruit to start out with - with the second Server.  I believe the original Server forgot about my fruit order as it took awhile just to get that.  We had to ask twice for small plates so that we could share the fruit.  I ordered the Avocado Toast for lunch ..  loved it.  It just needs some tomato and a bit more "toast" on the bread so that it can uphold the avocado content.  Lunch with two entrees and the fruit appetizer plus one soda was $68 with tax and tip.

Bottomless mimosas on the strip for $18...needless to say that's a win by itself. The food is relatively inexpensive given the location, but still fairly high in quality. Great place to go and get yourself pumped up for another day in Vegas.

Charles, server, did very well by me. Salmon salad was delectable, presented welI; salmon sweet and smokey. 

Atmosphere good. Music good.

Very friendly staff.

Not so fabulous.  We also had the weird experience of having to wait for seating in a mostly empty restaurant.  Our waiter was nice but distracted.  We waited awhile to order, to get the food, I had to ask if it was coming as people seated after us got their food before us, and we had to leave on time to catch flights home.  The food itself was ok, I had an omelet and it was no better or worse than any other omelet I've ever had.  My friend really liked the Scottish Egg.  I wouldn't come here again because the service was "meh" and the food was mediocre, but it is a nice view of the pool area and the decor is lovely.

Very happy with this place. My friend spencer and roig had bloody Mary's which they thought were very good. Although I didn't taste. I ordered a bagel because we are going to eat at a buffet later and I thought it tasted slightly fishy. But I offered a taste to 4 of my friends and they all disagreed.

Damn, I wasn't expecting an overtly touristy poolside cafe in the Cosmo to have one of the best brunches I've ever had...but there you go.  Surprises happen.

When I wandered in on a Friday morning, I was surprised at how bustling it was.  The place is light and bright, with orange walls and vintage photos all over the place.  Thankfully, the place is also quite large, and the tables turn over quickly, so I didn't have to wait for a place to sit.

Ordering was a no-brainer -- Overlook Grill touts its red velvet waffle, and that's exactly what I had.  And it lives up to the hype.  It's one of the best waffles I've ever had, red velvet-style or otherwise.  It was light and crispy, with a perfectly crisped exterior.  Oodles of fresh strawberries and whipped cream cheese gave it just the right amount of decadence, without making it heavy.

I washed down the waffle with a glass of "carrotine" juice -- a cold-pressed mix of carrots, apples, pineapple, ginger, and a few other things.  It tasted fabulous, and was a nice and healthy alternative to the typical mimosa.

Service was friendly and prompt the entire time I was there.  At no point did I ever feel rushed, and the staff were happy to make smalltalk and offer suggestions about restaurants to explore on the Strip, both at the Cosmo and elsewhere.  It's always nice to be a first-timer, but feel like a regular.

With those kind of positive vibes, there's no doubt I'll be back to Overlook Grill.
Ok food and service. Music was way, way too loud and they gave us a crappy table.

Located on the fourth floor of Cosmopolitan hotel, you can access this via elevator (no escalators--weird, but that's how it's built).

Came here for brunch on a warm Sunday morning around 11AM with a party of six, and we called ahead to let the hostess know that we were a big group. They need to update their yelp phone number, because the provided number is the Cosmo's general number. The host was friendly and assured us that we would be seated by 11:30AM, and she was pretty accurate in her guesswork!

Our server seemed pretty swamped during the lunch rush, but he was polite and doing his job without a problem. Our table had two bottomless mimosas, coffee, and sodas...and our mimosas, they only have OJ, were pretty yummy but slow to refill. In a period of two hours dining here, I only had four glasses total. I wanted to ask for a "to-go mimosa," but didn't know if that was appropriate.

If you're looking for a healthy dining area that isn't a buffet, Overlook Grill is your spot! My french toast was average price for Vegas standards, but the food quality was amazing! It was perfectly crispy and pillow-soft on the inside. They also have nutella cream for your dipping choice, and our server said it also came with syrup...but mine didn't come with it :( I also asked to only have syrup, but they brought it out with nutella sauce instead. I'm allergic to nuts, so I didn't use it. It also had a few sliced strawberries as well--perfect!

The main selling points about Overlook are the healthy options, controlled portion sizes in Vegas standards, and "beach-cabana-esque" vibes since Overlook literally overlooks the Cosmo pool (that's not Marquee). Diners can also use their pool's restrooms which are clean and beautiful--typical Cosmo. Service is polite and a bit slow, but they get their job done. After you're done with your meal, you can also take a saltwater taffy to go.

Definitely on the pricey side, however the food is delicious! I had a bagel that was toasted to perfection and the cream cheese was fluffy! My husband had the omelette which was loaded with avocado!!!! Yummy! Cool vibe, you feel like you're in Miami!

Really love this place. Was in Vegas for six days, discovered this little oasis day two, tried to make it back everyday. Main reasons are food was excellent, not too busy, bottomless mimosas even more excellent(tho 1 1/2 hr limit so come thirsty), but the best reason was our server: Peet. Coolest guy, on top of every request before even realized needed anything. Truly great! We love ya Peet!! Came last day, Peet was gone . Luckily Hallie was just as sweet

This is a small and laid back restaurant located at the cosmo pool. The location is very convenient if you are planning to have a quick bite before going to the pool.  We went during brunch on a Sunday and it was pretty busy. I would recommend to make a reservation before going. They also have all you can drink mimosas, rose or bloody Mary's at a reasonable price, $17, $22, $18. The food quality and tastes were average. I ordered the BLT Benedict's which was ok but not memorable. The Turkey burger was pretty big and filling. I would recommend it. 

Unfortunately, the quality of the service was not very good. We ordered guacamole as an appetizer and it never arrived. Our refills for the mimosas were not very consistent. We had to wait a long time to get them. I will most likely not come back unless I want to eat while i'm at the pool.

Hidden in the 4th floor of the Boulevard Tower at The Cosmopolitan is Overlook Grill.  We absolutely loved this casual brunch / lunch style modern and sheek restaurant that sits next to the pool area.  We didn't feel like standing in line at Egg Slut or any of the other popular spots, but just wanted to be seated quickly and get a meal.  Overlook Grill provided just that.  Because it is hidden, there isn't much of a wait usually.

They have bottomless mimosas for 1.5 hrs for $18, which is a deal in Vegas.  I ordered the Breakfast Burrito with Chicken, which was huge and easily shareable.  Eggs Your Way was nice as well.  Our server brought out some Chalula to add some spice.  She also kept the coffee refills coming as we enjoyed a brisk breeze in the half indoor / half outdoor setting.  They have a couple of TVs in case you want to watch something.  Everyone from the hostess to waitress and support staff were extremely amicable.

Take the time to find this spot on your trip, because you will probably spend even more time in line elsewhere.  Brunch on!

It's reasonably priced for Vegas. We were here for lunch and since we're staying at the casino we wanted something that was no fuss and quick. The ambiance from the pool is great. The service was great. Everyone from the busboy to the waitress were quick and attentive. 

The food was good, too. I had the Ancho chicken torta and it has just the right amount of kick to it. My boyfiend had the skirtsteak torta. The meat on his was so juicy and the beef was so soft, it was delicious. The fries were crisp. He has the Modela Michelada and he thought is was delicious and so well priced! ($15 for 24 oz michelada... this is Vegas, after all)
I'd come here again without any hesitation.

A delightful early morning location.  This, especially because the 24hr Henry is under renovation.  Super comfortable outdoor seating and mostly in the shade, the place is super-clean.  Ordered the fruit plate which was so  so fresh, big, and came with a nice maple yogurt as well as the rejuvenation drink which was what the doctor ordered.  Excellent & friendly service for breakfast!
Hands down best waitress was Hallie. Bottomless mimosas are a must. Food was to die for. Highly recommend eating here for breakfast or brunch.

My boyfriend and I ate here for breakfast, I ordered the typical bacon and eggs breakfast. Nothing special but it was just right. Everything was cooked perfect and the bacon was thick and delicious. Perfect hangover breakfast. We were the only ones in the restaurant at one point so the service was good, very attentive.

Perfect spot for lunch. A nice and relaxing vibe by the pool. Perfect place to have a light meal and sip on white vino or sangria to keep a nice day buzz going.
 I enjoyed just kicking back and people watching while eating and sipping on my vino...a little hard to find but worth it IMO...

The hostess @ the front desk needed a bloody mary more than my friends hahaha
0_o

Unless you're staying at the Cosmopolitan or making your way to their Boulevard Pool, you might completely overlook the Overlook Grill and that would be a shame.

We discovered the Overlook Grill on our way to the hotel's pool for an early morning swim and were pleased to see they were open at 8 am for breakfast. Breakfast options at the Cosmopolitan are limited to the Wicked Spoon buffet or The Henry, and we did not want to be too stuffed before our swim. So much for that plan when we were presented with their decadent menu.

It happened to be restaurant week during our visit late last month, and the Overlook Grill was offering an incredible $20.12 breakfast that was served in three courses. It included: a berry and melon fruit plate with a perfectly sweet yogurt Panna Cotta; a juicy flat iron steak and quail eggs with a spicy chorizo and fingerling potato hash; and house-made ricotta "munchkin" donuts with vanilla creme and raspberry jelly dipping sauces for a sweet end to breakfast. The missus had basically the same thing, but opted for the stuffed french toast with whipped mascarpone, strawberry jam and an almond maple butter as her second course.

Both meals pleased us tremendously, and while we would now have to wait at least an hour before swimming, it was a perfect start to our lazy day by the pool.

As breakfast signaled how the Overlook Grill can go beyond the basics while simply catering to hungry poolside revelers, we tried them a couple of days later for lunch. Their small plates menu was perfect for poolside snacking, was also quite tasty, and was fortunately a lot lighter than our overindulgence at breakfast. I would highly recommend the fried calamari served with an orange and basil aioli, and the divine pork belly lettuce wraps with pickled cucumbers and an harissa dressing.

High quality ingredients plus a simple and satisfying menu equals a great waiting experience. The hostess staff, bus boy, server and other staff were all friendly and professional. I should dock a star just cause it's a pain to get to, but then I think about the fruit cup and how each piece of fruit seemed hand selected, and five stars seems fitting after all.

the grilled steakburger with fries was good, however when we got there and said 2 in our party, the lady is like its going to be a wait and she was really  BI***y about it too, uh there is barely anyone in the restaurant??? WTF?
there were so many open tables, I didnt get it???
then this other couple comes and they tell them the same thing and then this group of girls...so we are waiting and at 1 point we were like should we just get fast food??? what is going on here and finally we were like were going somewhere else and girl is like why, and they call our name...
I would rather eat at mcdonalds I could have walked there and back faster then the wait at this place and I could understand it if it was PACKED but it was pretty much EMPTY!!!! Walk to Mcdonalds it will be faster....

My daughter had a craving for eggs Benedict and we tried this place for the first time. Ordered the Crab Benedict which was really good. Thought it would be made like the florentine, but still lots of flavor nonetheless. The service was great wish I could have remembered her name. My daughter really enjoyed eating outside and would have loved to go to the pool right after, we were told pool is for guests only.  like I said at least the food was good

O.K the outdoor seating on a bright sunny day was great. Service was fine. Wife wanted the half portion of fruit salad. It looked tired...some of the green grapes were turning yellow and only grapes and pineapple?. If you want a fruit salad bellagio cafe does much better. I ordered a bloody mary, at $12 no celery or olives? Sky Box grill at Aria has a $10 B.M that will rock your socks off. Had the fish tacos (2 for $12). While the fish was fine the salsa was weird. Ate 75% of one of them and gave the wife the other. At about $40 with tip I can't say I was happy.

I loved this restaurant, it was the perfect place to stop for lunch with excellent food, great drinks and even better service. We were starving but were really looking for something healthy and this place was exactly what we needed to recuperate and become ourselves again after a long night of partying. There were 10 of us for a bachelorette weekend and we were sat at a long table outside, but there was a large overhang so we weren't that hot. The Overlook Grill is located right next to the pool, which is really convenient and pretty. Our server was fantastic. Most of us went with the unlimited Champagne option, which was unbelievably cheap, maybe $12 or so and he kept refilling our carafes for over an hour and a half. We greatly appreciated this. Sometimes when you go to all you can drink brunches, it takes forever for the server to come over and get you another drink, there is a time limit and regardless of how quickly or slow they move, your time will be up. This sever made sure we were never without champagne it was fantastic. He also made sure we had tons of water, again appreciated. The menu looked awesome, I went with the detox bowl, which was exactly what I needed. It was seriously delicious. It had quinoa, kale, apple, dried cranberries, broccoli, avocado, cilantro maple dressing and I added chicken. Nice portion and the price was right too. There were tons of salads, sandwiches, breakfast type food and they even had a separate gluten free menu. Their Bloody Mary was so good too, very spicy just how I like it. This is the perfect place to come for lunch or brunch for healthy food and tasty drinks without breaking the bank.

I've been to Vegas several times but , I hadn't been here before . I will definitely be back , I liked my food and I like the bottomless mimosas especially overlooking the pool in the cosmopolitan. Why I didn't give it a 5 star ? It sucked walking around and around the hotel just looking for this place . We found an entrance initially but , we were told it was for guests only . There does need to be better signs . Overally I would go back , I had a good time and the service was awesome !

I've eaten here twice now- once for lunch and once for breakfast. I suggest having breakfast here- not lunch.

After an incredibly late night, and only a few hours of sleep, my girlfriend and I wanted breakfast, but weren't willing to leave the hotel. We arrived just before 11 a.m., and were told they weren't serving breakfast anymore. (Umm this is Vegas...seriously, no breakfast post 11 a.m.?) After some begging, pleading, and frankly looking rather pitiful, our server checked with the kitchen and an exception was made. (We tipped her rather well for this!)

I ordered a omelet with bacon, avocado, and cheese and was pleasantly surprised.

As we ALWAYS stay at the cosmo, we'll be sure to be back! That being said, I hope Overlook extends its breakfast hours in the future.

Solid, simple food done right.  Perfect for a quick snack if you're on the Strip snaking your way through the casinos.

They also offer menus for the choice or chance diner (vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, allergic to shellfish). Very cool especially considering poker players today.

Starters are the best bet.  The crispy cauliflower  with its creamy roasted garlic and smoked paprika aioli and the smoked wahoo fish dip and lavosh crackers are outstanding.

Prices are typical of a Vegas resort.

Note:  The hours of operation are short.  This is strictly a lunch place (breakfast if you're a poker player).

We went into this restaurant to grab some food to go. I have eaten here before and had good experiences but this time we went in for take out.... The hostesses completely ignores us and hoed all of the people who were being seated. We even overheard a conversation in which one hostess asked the other if she should help us and she straight up said "no"!  Please remember the phrase "first come, first served"!  To make matters worse, one of us had been served already, and the other was still waiting to be helped. 
Once we got back to the room to eat, the food was really good and that made me give this restaurant a 2!  
From the outside, the restaurant looks pretty busy... A lot of people go to this restaurant before or after the pool.
The food was fresh and the rest of the menu looked really good too. The server was nice and did a good job.

4 stars for the service and the food which was phenomenal. As far as timing goes wow. Took forever for the food. Server was awesome though and drinks came out too notch. Keep up the great work guys. 

Not upset about the time it took for food, I have s feeling the kitchen is over worked. But still sent out a great product.

This is a surprisingly pleasant place for brunch, despite being nestled within the purple-and-plastic Cosmopolitan casino. The menu is a bit limited but includes a "bubbles and brunch" option which included bottomless mimosas, monkey bread, and a brunch entrée. They brought our table mimosas by the carafe and all the food was well made. Crab cakes Benedict was delicious but the portions were small. A slightly expanded menu and more generous portions would earn this place a fifth star from me.

Had an awesome meal after a day of sunbathing. 

Sat outside and the waitress was sweet and attentive. Got a seat in front of the TV and watched NFL football while enjoying our meal!

Got a bunch of small dishes which were all great. The fish tacos were yummy, loved the hard and soft shells. Loved the blue crab lettuce wraps which did not skimp at all with the crab meat. The asian buns were okay but my least favorite because the meat.. I wasn't too sure what that was. However, all dishes felt light and fresh with fresh veggies and light sauces!

The Overlook Grill is one of the greatest restaurant's I've been to in Vegas to date. They have an amazing outside area that overlooks pools, ping pong tables, pool tables, and huge flat screens.

The waitress asked what our plans were for the night (we were interested in going to see the show Le Reve), and she called one of her close friends and attempted to get us free tickets, what great service!

We had a Fantastic Breakfast here during our recent stay at The Cosmopolitan. The Hostess quickly sat us at a perfect table for a Hot Vegas Summer Morning. Outside, but with enough shade to keep us comfortable.

Our waitress Jeannie, was wonderful. Friendly and attentive without being overbearing. We started our morning with an order of Warm Monkey Bread with Toasted Pecans. Little Doughballs of Heaven in Bundt Cake form. Each bite was like the best part of a Cinnamon Roll. Soft and tender with a slight crunch from the Caramelized Syrup on the edges. It was messy, but we loved every sticky bite!

For entrees, I had the Overlook Omelet with Smoked Bacon, Fresh Tomato, Fresh Avocado and Monterey Jack Cheese. It was served with Breakfast Potatoes and Sourdough Toast. Diane had the Baked Eggs, 'Shakshuka' Style. Sunny Side Up Eggs with a Spicy Tomato-Red Pepper Sauce, Potatoes, Feta Cheese, Fresh Basil with warm Pita Bread.

My Omelet was one of the best I've ever had. Light and Fluffy with the perfect ratio of egg to filling. Most importantly, it tasted great too. Diane loved her eggs. The bite she let me try was an interesting combination of flavors and textures. The only negative was that the Pita Bread was hard and Flavorless. She used some of my Sourdough Bread to sop up the delicious sauce at the bottom of her dish. The Overlook Grill is easily wheelchair accessible and a very pleasant place to grab an excellent breakfast before a dip in the pool. We will definitely be back!

Stumbled upon this place while lost in the Cosmopolitan. 

Loved it!

So bright, so yummy, and right next to the pool.

Made us feel like it was Summer time, even though we were sadly reminded it was 40 degrees as we walked out. 

I had the Pork tostadas which were amazing and my friend had the cheeseburger which was really good. The sides of fruit were fresh and our waitress just so down to earth. 

Definitely happy we stumbled (literally) across this place. It's going to be a must in the Summer.

We came here on my birthday for breakfast and it was GREAT. And emptyish.

Okay so I may have been drunk about 20 minutes in due to the bottomless mimosas (but I mean who DOESN'T want all you can drink mimosas), and I may not really remember what we ate but the key points are:

1. Drinks were great.
2. I remember I got an omelette and it didn't even look real it was so perfect. & delicious.
3. The service was great.

I wish I could remember our servers name. All I do remember is that she was super chill, liked The Lumineers, & talked to us about Pokemon Go. I like when someone actually talks to me at a restaurant like I'm a person and not just paying their bills. Though I won't really fault you for it, it just makes the experience nicer. 

ANYWAY, 2 carafe's of Mimosa later (she totally offered us a third and sadly we declined), we decided to go off and explore. 
In reality, we were handed TO GO MIMOSAS WHICH IS THE BEST THING EVER and went back to our room and took drunk food coma naps. 

5/5 would drunk again.

Me and the boyfriend met some people here for Sunday brunch. Warning, this is a pretty small spot, so things can be a bit hectic. Fortunately, we had a reservation, and were seated right away. Service was pretty good. While one of us had to wait for their food a bit longer than necessary, our unlimited mimosas were never empty, and they even gave us one to go (score)! :) The ambiance was nice and modern, and our table overlooked the pool area. Now for my favorite part, the food. 

The table received an order of the monkey bread. While I was not a fan, everyone else at the table thought it was great. 

Duck Confit Poutine - this was my first time trying duck confit and a poutine, and it did not disappoint! The duck confit was phenomenal, and I am a fan of all things potato. I think they may have taken some liberties with calling it a poutine, as it was more of a tomato sauce rather than a gravy, but delicious nonetheless. Topped with a perfectly cooked sunny side up egg, and this dish was a winner. 

Blue Claw Crabcake Benedict - unfortunately, I only got one bite of this dish before my boyfriend cleared his plate in no time flat. Needless to say, he loved it!

The other two in our party had the chicken and waffles and the grilled skirt steak sandwich. I did note get to try either, but they liked both dishes.

I typically try to only post positive reviews. However I can not do so with this place. We went to celebrate the birthday of my daughter's good friend. There were 8 of us. So the tip was automatically added. We thought we were going for a Restaurant Week breakfast/brunch based on menus we read online. However, we were told that was not available after noon. Our reservation was for noon. 

Then, we were overwhelmed by the denial of what we thought we were going for, so we ordered the full brunch for everyone, which was a HUGE mistake. It was $40 per person. The assortment of things they delivered were often cold, uncoordinated and just out of sync with the next item. There was one item that was good--The Jumbo Lump Crabcake Benedict with Creole Hollandaise. Unfortunately, however, by the time it was served we were all already stuffed from the other things that they delivered. If I had ordered and enjoyed only that this would have been a 4 star rating (except for the service). 

The staff were untrained and seemed unknowing and uncaring. We asked about a Ramos Fizz as a cocktail and they said, well you tell us what is in it and we will see if they know how to make it. We did not want to run the risk that the bartender did not know how to make it so we ordered Bellini instead. 

When I went to check on whether they could do anything special for the 19th birthday the waitress said ohhh, um...do you mean LIKE candles? Um we don't do that. I said fine. 

Our group included 3 adults over 21 and 5 teens aged 15, 16, 18, 18, and 19. The adults had cocktails with brunch.
