Then near the end of the brunch when they brought out the assorted desserts (included in the brunch even though they have already served 7  courses and everyone is stuffed) they had one plate that was only chocolate dipped strawberries and put it down by the teenagers. Then they brought out a plate of several other interesting looking cooked deserts and puddings. The waitress then said that the desserts  included alcohol and could not be consumed by the minors. I have dined very often in Las Vegas and I have never seen or heard anyone do or say this before.  Since we adults were stuffed and the strawberries went quickly, we passed the other desserts down to the teenagers (no one was driving.) They tried them all and enjoyed them. 

I would not normally have done that but 1) they were all disappointed with how "weird" the brunch was and 2) I felt that this should have been explained to us when we ordered if more than half of our table could not enjoy the dessert we were paying for in advance. 

Then while they enjoyed the desserts the dining staff acted normal and no one mentioned a word about the desserts being eaten by the teenagers. 

Then even though this brunch ended up costing over $500 for  8 of us we left disappointed in how odd it was and how unorganized and uncaring the wait staff was. The whole thing was odd and disappointing. If you do eat there--do NOT order the brunch.

I wore jeans and it was about 80 degrees in there... We asked them to turn up the air conditioning and they said we were right next to the best spot for air conditioning haha. 

Bloody Mary's were excellent, as well as the mimosas. Food was ok.

This tucked away gem sits next to the pool area on the 4th floor. It's not too big but it's serving up really quality eats at extremely reasonable prices for being on the Strip! My grilled mahi mahi with herb chimmichurri and mango salsa was spectacular, and only $20! Great brunch cocktails and very chill ambiance being on the pool patio. Lots of classic brunch dishes, burgers, fish tacos, salads and more. 

I would have given 5 stars but the hostesses slipped a bit. We came to restaurant and were told a 15 min wait and they took my phone number to notify us. We told them we were going to head to the bar. After 20+ mins passed and we saw other tables get seated who came after us we went back to them to ask what the situation was. They said they called me, left a voicemail and only hold tables 5 mins. Unfortunately they didn't call, I had my phone in my hand the entire time as I was taking pictures and videos and there was no voicemail. They insisted they called but there was no record of anything. So word to the wise, make sure they have your correct number down since I imagine they took down the wrong number.

The Overlook restaurant is adjacent to the excellent pool area of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, and seemed like an ideal spot for lunch on a sunny afternoon. Service was friendly and fairly efficient. Our waitress suggested a ceviche appetizer, which appealed, but ended up disappointing all of us. The mystery fish looked like pink chicken pieces and was tasteless. Squeezing lime over the preparation gave a hint of citrus, but the marinade was bland otherwise, and the pieces of "fish" actually were frightening when examined closely. Truly mystery meat!

I ordered Caesar Salad, which turned out to be a very expensive bowl of romaine pieces and stale croutons tossed in a bitter dressing that tasted nothing like Caesar, and was not a creative substitute. My husband's fried clams tasted almost as good as Mrs. Swanson's frozen variety, and our friend's sandwich was stale. All items we ordered are difficult to botch, but this place succeeded brilliantly at that.

It would be easy for The Overlook to provide tasty, simple food. But their offerings are tasteless at best and overpriced. We are happy to pay well for good food, but the items we tried here were very disappointing. Try the pizza on the second floor, or any of the other dining choices at The Cosmopolitan, but avoid The Overlook!

I suspect that the good reviews on Yelp came from folks who were enjoying the pool scene, the attractive waitresses, and their cocktails.

I came here for a quick bite to eat since it overlooked the pool at our hotel and I assumed it would be relaxing to watch all the alcoholics while eating. I was wrong. We didn't even get to sit anywhere to overlook anything. We sat inside, I wasn't complaining though. I was hungover, it was whatever.
For us, when we got seated and ordered, everything got confusing. I thought our hostess was the hostess and then later it seemed like she was the waitress, then later our waitress came out so we didn't know who we were even tipping. 
I ordered the fish tacos which seemed to be the only appetizing thing on the menu, I was wrong, again. The presentation was nice and the fish was breaded, but, it, was, horrible. Especially for the price! My friend ordered a sandwich and it was much better tasting and cheaper than what I ordered.
Our hostess was great, we never got to know our server and the food was bad. I won't be back. Go to Henry's instead.

We were in a party of six, made reservations a few days in advance, for lunch on Sunday. We were seated promptly and our waitress was cheerful and attentive. Great selection of menu choices as well as drinks. I had the huevos rancheros which included chicken. My wife had the fish tacos. The monkey bread was a good starter. Adjacent to the pool, it's a bright and airy spot.

Turkey burger came undercooked but they made me a new one that wasn't so bad. This is definitely a pool cafe though. Not really a place to come to unless it's convenient. Fish tacos weren't bad. Also be ware: no breakfast all day.

Service is bad/slow and they will never refill your water.

Delicious breakfast with great natural sunlight. My husband both had the omelettes and quinoa salad with a side of freshly table-side made guacamole. Everything was delicious and service was a bonus. The fresh green juice is a MUST!

After days of heavy eating and cocktails I needed something fresh and found it at the Overlook Grill. Airy space and a good vibe added to the pleasurable late breakfast/early lunch. My waiter, Gustavo, could not have been more pleasant and appropriately attentive. 

I ate simply, (fresh fruit platter and the chopped salad) and it hit the spot!  I wished I was up for a cocktail, as they had a bottomless bubbly or mimosa that looked great. The breakfast food going by looked great and plentiful. 

The restaurant is a little hard to find (three escalators up) but more than worth it.

We were looking for a full breakfast, but didn't want to travel too far from the hotel for it. So we gave the concierge a call for a recommendation and this was once of the ones they highly recommended for our breakfast. Unfortunately, we stayed in the West tower and the Overlook Grill is located at the East Tower poolside, so it was a bit of a walk. However, when we finally reached the restaurant we were pleasantly surprised at the casual ambiance and decor and nice view of the pool area. There is indoor and outdoor seating, and it was a nice morning so most people opted for outdoor seating. We chose to sit inside where it was less crowded and felt very homey. Service was good and friendly, but it was the breakfast that really impressed me.

I ordered the Eggs Your Way which is made up of 3 eggs any style, choice of Breakfast Sausage, Chicken Apple Sausage or Hobbs Bacon, the signature house potatoes, and a choice of toast. I ordered an egg white scramble with Chicken Apple Sausage with toasted sourdough, and really enjoyed it. My friends ordered Overlook Omelette and they too enjoyed it very much. The portions were quite large so you'd better be hungry. The only complaint were from my friends as they didn't seem to enjoy the coffees they ordered very much. However, I enjoyed my whole breakfast and hot tea....and all for a very reasonable price.

Looking outside on the outdoor patio area we noticed a table enjoying a basket of pastries and a large bottle of champagne with their orange juice.....we so wanted to try this mimosa, but figured we had had enough alcohol the night before, but would definitely come back and try this perhaps the next morning. Nice breakfast, good friendly service, and pleasantly quiet and casual atmosphere made for a very enjoyable breakfast experience.

Food was delicious. Only gripe was that there weren't many options, at least for breakfast. Atmosphere was good for a breakfast/brunch setting.  Don't see myself planning to go back anytime soon because of the lack of options but if someone asked me because they'd want to try it, I'd go knowing whatever I order will be good.

The chicken that comes with the chicken and waffles was disgusting as I couldn't even finish it. Monkey bread was completely burned and as hard as a brick. Turkey burger had an Asian-inspired taste? The waitress didn't know what she was doing. Service was HORRIBLE. I am not sure why this place comes up under best brunch places in Vegas, extremely disappointed.
Food was good. Make your own mimosa was perfect after night 1 of EDC. Britney- B was quite possible the best server we've ever had in Vegas.

I didn't get a great first impression.  Coming up to the escalator I was told I couldn't go up without a room key even though I had reservations.   If this was the policy then that would be ok but I was told by a different employee that I should have been let up.   When we were leaving other guests who were not hotel guests were being allowed use of the escalator by a different employee at the stand.

The food was actually pretty good for a hotel pool cafe.   We were there at 11am and got the breakfast menu.   

Shakshouka was actually quite tasty and the eggs were cooked right. 

My family enjoyed their various omelets. 

One note was that the fruit plate was actually worth the money.   Fresh tropical fruit.   Not one bad piece and plenty of it.  I was actually surprised at how big the plate was compared to other cafes on the strip. 

Overall, if you're staying at Cosmopolitan this is a good place to eat even in 110 degree weather.

Great ambience in the shade overlooking the Cosmopolitan pool area. Even at 95 degrees a cool breeze flows through the open air restaurant and you never feel hot. We had breakfast. Highly recommend the decadent French toast sticks. Make sure you ask for them to be well done or they might be a little mushy, which ruins it. Waitstaff was very pleasant. Great place for breakfast and great great food.
Peet provided them best service ever. Attentive, intuitive, present. Very few waiters of this caliber. Food was awesome, best bacon Bloody Mary ever. But the service was what stood out.

The pool at Cosmo is great--people to watch and tasty drinks to consume.  But this grill is mediocre at best for lunch.  We got there at ~1pm hoping for a late brunch.  We were a group of 8.  Even though it was half empty, we inexplicably had to wait 20 minutes.  When we asked why we could not sit in the empty seats, we were told that we had only waited 8 minutes (after having been told the wait was 20 minutes).  Thanks for creating an artificial wait time.  

The waitress was nice and earns the second star.  Despite a bus boy dropping a tray of ice water behind (soaking some of us and my friend's backpack), the service inside was excellent.

My biggest gripe is the lack of any vegetarian options.  This is 2013.  We could not order breakfast because they stop serving breakfast at 11am.  Who at the Cosmo has breakfast before 11am?  Really, the closet thing to a main course for a vegetarian at lunch is below-average hummus and pita?  The sides were okay.  The guacamole was tasty.  We ended up making up for the awful lunch with a feast at China Poblano.  

The best thing was the waitress did not charge me for the coffee I got because of some computer error.

I would not go back for lunch.

If you're staying at the Cosmopolitan anyway, this is a great place for breakfast.  Delicious French toast, tasty breakfast burritos, and an excellent bloody Mary with a strip of bacon and chipotle infused vodka (the kind of bloody Mary that you eat! yum). 

It was the perfect way to get our vacation started.

Overlook Grill offers relatively inexpensive snacks/meals for those visiting the Cosmopolitan.  Unfortunately or fortunately, depending on how you look at it, it is located on the fourth floor where the pools are located.  Most people don't even know it is there, and most only manage to find it by stumbling upon it as they explore the vastness of the Cosmopolitan.

In the evening, especially during the weekdays, it is simply closed.  Not a soul to be seen inside the restaurant.  So I assume they do the majority of their business during lunch service.  Their menus are also found near the pool, so I would imagine that food can be ordered directly from where you are lounging at the Blvd Pool or Bamboo Pool (the other pool at the Cosmopolitan, located on the East side of the building).

The best thing about the food served here, is the freshness of the ingredients. The menu is pretty simple, nothing extravagant, but it offers relatively inexpensive snacks that will accommodate the majority of the visitors' vacation budget. 

Decor - 4.5/5  Really bright, even at night. 
Service - 4/5/5 It is not a busy restaurant, so service is expected to be attentive.
Price - 4/5 Very agreeable on the wallet, especially considering the location. Only place cheaper would be to hit up the Pizzeria on the 3rd floor.
Location - 4/5  Perfect for those vacationing on the Strip near Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, Aria, Vdara, Planet Hollywood, etc.

....was not impressed... I know their menu is seasonal... but... it's just not that great. The Monkey bread was the best thing they had on the menu... and the first time I've ever seen Monkey bread on a menu, that's the only perk. It's a beautiful little place right next to the pool... and it's very small, just a heads up. The customer service wasn't  that great, it took forever to get our food and it wasn't even busy. My friend and myself sent our food back. She had the chicken and waffles and said it was horrible. I had a noodle soup thing... I went to fork my noodles out and a big clump of coagulated noodles came up on my fork... ICK! I sent it back and got the pulled pork sandwich. thankfully that was ok... just ok. I've had better... I wouldn't waste my time here, there's sooo many other great places to eat, but if you're craving some warm, honey, nutty Monkey bread... make the time to get some!
